item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
mathematically, the best way to gain ally points is to use tictac and jdiddy with whomeever you wanna hang out with. together along with love love paradize you get 10x the hangout points per mission (450 instead of 45).
With some unpopular teammates a mere 1000 is enough (you need to have over 1000 to hang out). You can "prime" them by getting all your targets up to 900 the day before (guarantees they will not hang out with you), and you can throw all out bashes for 10,000 FP divided equally (so, 3333 FP per team member on 3 people team).

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I hanged out with 7 allies. Most likely the best allies would be Ro-Sham-Bo, most higher-level allies like Smiley, Blind Fury, EoTS allies, PH allies which need 1001FP to hang out. Try Tsukasa or Kagamin, they are veery easy to get (especially for Legacy hehe). Basically, for a medium amount of money and stamina it's very easy to accomplish and get the useless theme.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: The party house allies are and easy give. But also The big Ro, Bo, and Shammy have low friend points also along with inner wasteland allies.

item.title: Getting four hangouts
item.content:encoded: For what its worth I can't see the problem here, just use the less popular allies especially those that don't give mission bonuses and include a friend points ally like Tictac on the team. Several allies routinely only need 10,000 points or less so it only takes one day to "prime" them to 9000 points or so. I used three teams and ended up hanging out with six allies.

item.title: Trivia
item.content:encoded: wow,that surprisedme. Kinda expected a Orihime (Bleach)+Yachiru (Bleach) + catgirl kinda kidâ€¦

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: We can't use the Mysterious Power Bloodline because you can only hang out with an ally if you're not hanging out with any other ally

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I'm not sure what's unspecific about "Hang out with four or more allies in one day." But yes, you have to have 4 (or more) people hanging out with you when the dayroll occurs in order to get Nadeshiko.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: The page is unspecific: Do you have to get all of these people at hanging out status within a dayroll, or is this just total?
